title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: it was great, easy discussion, very friendly and helpful. told me about my position and what I would be doing day to day. Yea we can go for dinner tonight or something for me to go with the other person and then we are
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Great very easy questions. The process was short and to the point, asked a lot of behavioral. Strengths, weakness and the future of my career were topics that were included.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your experiences?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with several staff members and all were very warm and friendly. We were all on the same page about past employment goals, metrics, etc… then ghosted. I asked the HR Recruiter for feedback and I was told that I could not articulate my accomplishments. What? I had been working on government contracts-all I know is being able to demonstrate my accomplishments verbally and written. The ghosting was unprofessional and the feedback was just a filler.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you go about working with an undecided undergrad?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a very Easy process Make Sure Come focus and prepared for your interview Be on time target key areas In the medical field Try other medical setting
Interview Questions: Describe a time where u handle a a very patient

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied and got called immediatly for an interview. Did round 1 and then was contacted for round 2. Logged into the round 2 interview and two people joined as expected, but then they were confused because they said it was supposed to be only one of them. One left the interview and said they would reschedule. The coordinator reached out and wanted to schedule somethign 2 hours late. Seems like mis communication and poor coordination, but I made it work because I was interested in the role. 

All the interviewers said they were in a rush to fill the role and after 3 separate interviews, ghosted me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Pace?

title: Learning Commons Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for part-time position with hours ranging up to 16 hours per week for $24/hour. Interviewed by two people who asked in-depth questions about past experience and required detailed explanations and follow-up explanations to questions.
Interview Questions: Explain tutoring process and challenges in-depth.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: The first round of the interview is a quick phone screening to discuss your background and relevant qualifications. The interview was straight forward, the interviewer was respectful, and there were no trick questions. They were very good about contacting me after the interview.
Interview Questions: Discuss any past analytical experience.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Submit your resume first and you will be notified. Then wait to see if the resume is selected, and then notify the time of the interview.Very simple application process. But it will take a long time to wait for the notification
Interview Questions:
Introduce yourself?
Introduce your projects?
Are you currently a student?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions:
Please describe a crazy situation you have to handle?  and how to deal with it ? Please mention why do you want to work here ?
How have your clinical rotations prepared your career in nursing ?
Interview Questions: Why you want work here ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Short interview.one round.zoom interview with you and your family and friends is the best of luck in your bachelor's degree in the future of our classmates and co-workers and customers to your place and I will be in the ttty.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
Job experience

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process lasted about a month which I believe was pretty fast for higher education.  I had about 4 different interviews before I received an offer. Initially I received a phone call, then an interview with the admissions panel, an interview with the Dean of admissions and an interview with the VP. Everyone was super nice and I felt comfortable. The questions were average and straight forward. Make sure you do your homework and you'll be fine.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
How do you feel about working in a fast paced environment?
What are your strengths?
How can you relate past experience to this specific position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Pace University in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very friendly and smooth. Gives more importance to knowledge and analytical skills rather than what background you have. So bias decisions on selcting candidates. They help you navigate through the whole process easily.
Interview Questions: How will you manage to many students at a time and how will you assist them?

title: Finance Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, nice, and professional. The individuals who interviewed were kind and sweet. They were great listeners asking about my resume. I received a phone call the next day that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Can you work in a high stress environment

title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pace University in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Basic introductory questions
Research-related questions
Depends on the interviewer to interviewer
Resume related questions 
Overall, not too difficult
Your resume does the maximum work I would say
All the best guys!
What else can i add lol
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
What are your goals?

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: In depth and considerate of your interest in the role and how you think you might do in the role and be most challenged. The process was very interesting and helpful.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was two rounds face to face interview. Also, you need to complete an online application. For the first round, most questions are general questions. The second round has more
Interview Questions: How to help a student when they are frustrated.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: 1 on 1 in-person interview (pre-covid) with hiring manager who asked specific questions related to the role and that expressed their knowledge of the field and expectations for the position.
Interview Questions: Question example: How do you approach working with a student who is struggling with their current assignments?

title: Head of Music Theatre Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Typical Skype Panel asking questions, panel each taking turns asking a set of prepared questions . Focusing on expectations for the position, Challenges and opportunities ,the strengths and weaknesses of the program.
Interview Questions: Describe how your past experience has prepared you for this position

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: During the interview process, I had to go into the office three times to meet with different people within the department.  When meeting with the different employees they all focused their questions on my past experiences and questions related to the position I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What type of events have you planned?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Pace University in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was good. Fairly easy questions and the interviewer was very friendly and comforting while conducting the interview process. They also offered snack after the interview was done outside. It was good. Fairly easy questions and the interviewer was very friendly and comforting while conducting the interview process. They also offered snack after the interview was done outside.
Interview Questions: How much exp do you have? What is your salary exp? Do you need sponsorship?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Very calm, easy-going, questions about yourself, friendly. Interviewer was very friendly and asked questions to see how you would answer them. Overall, satisfactory interview process. Would definitely recommend applying and be calm during the interview
Interview Questions: What do you like to do during your free time?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a written application, recorded interview, and in-person interview. The in person interview has two Resident Directors asking scenario based question to see what would you do under pressure.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you knew someone who was homesick?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: It was on academics and scholarly activities. Based on the duties that were fulfilled in the previous role facilitated by me. It included a vast array of administrative and functional performance attributes.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to the position?

title: Nursing Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Pace University (Pleasantville, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview; about 10 interviewees at once and 3 interviewers. About 4 questions posed to the group, and everyone gets a chance to stand at the front and give their answer.
Interview Questions: What is something about you NOT on your application that sets you apart from the others applicants?

title: Staff Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process. First I  met the direct supervisor and rest of the department in the second round of interviews. I also took a writing test that had grammar and a short essay section
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3 years

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Went to FOUR interviews, each a step up from the next and 3 of them in Manhattan. After the fourth interview I never heard anything back. I even reached out to who I was supposed to work for and heard nothing back. No updates - nothing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a mistake you made and how you fixed it.

title: Web Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: I went through two interviews. One with the hiring manager and one with the team. The interview was very casual. There was also a writing test that was not difficult. I accepted the job.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to get out of this job?

title: Marketing and Editorial Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very “hurry up and wait.” It took nearly four months from initial application to, ultimately, an impersonal, templated rejection email in which it was claimed that a different candidate had been selected — only to see the very same job opening come up on my Indeed feed. Additionally, was asked to tackle an on-site proofreading test and three writing tests. Once I had submitted the written materials, it was complete radio silence — even after I emailed a few weeks later to inquire about selection process. Nothing. Please show more respect to candidates.
Interview Questions: I no longer recall specific questions. But I don’t remember anything that seemed “out there” or unusual for this type of position.

title: Financial Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a call to set up an interview, interviewed with dept head and employee who worked in the dept. and never heard back even tho it went great and they said they will get back to me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here ?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: pretty straight forward.  only took a few days for me to get hired.  only one round of an interview.  met in person within one day. got an offer immediately after I left
Interview Questions: How does your past experiences relate to this one

title: Staff Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Not much of a process. Basic interview and then offered the position a few days after. 

Not much of a process. Basic interview and then offered the position a few days after.
Interview Questions:
What are your thoughts on.....?
How would you approach....?

title: Staff Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Not much of a process. Basic interview and then offered the position a few days after. 

Not much of a process. Basic interview and then offered the position a few days after.
Interview Questions:
What are your thoughts on.....?
How would you approach....?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Only needed to submit my resume. One of the senior referred me for the position. There was no formal interview. Process took 3-4 weeks. Got offer in 1 week and then Paper work took 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Heard back within a couple of days applying. First phone interview, then followed up with 2nd panel interview the following week. Had to give a presentation. Did not hear back for a month, then received email about going with another candidate. During the interview, everyone was friendly, and the questions were interesting. At first everyone seemed uninterested, but picked up after 15 or so minutes. Typical questions about work experience,  situational questions, then personal questions. Although I was not offered a position, and it took what felt like forever to hear back, it was positive and it went well.
Interview Questions: I'm a student who wants to be a star - is the admissions process the same for me?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
My caveat for my review is that I do not work in academia and perhaps do not understand the hiring process for that industry.

I was referred in to a position and also applied online. Approximately 3 months after I completed the online application I received an email from an interview coordinator who turned out to be a part time assistant for the hiring manager (a VP level). I was asked for my availability to come in for a committee interview and was given a list of 8-10 names who would be at that interview. When I asked if I needed to prepare anything, I was told no. Even though only 4 people from the list actually attended, this committee interview was somewhat stressful because I am not used to this interview format. At least everyone was professional, polite, and asked informed questions. I had no idea how I 'did' at the interview and did not hear any feedback nor receive any responses from my thank you emails.

I did not hear anything for about 2 more months when I got another email from the interview coordinator congratulating me for being a finalist for the role and asking my availability for another committee interview. This time I was sent a list of about 8 very high level people who would attend. Again, I was told that I did not need to prepare anything. All 8 people on this list attended this interview  -- and it was extremely stressful as there was one person on the committee who outranked all of the others. I felt that this individual guided most of the questioning and tone of the meeting and perhaps the other people in the room did not feel free to speak.  Again, after the meeting I had no idea how it 'went' and never received any feedback.

One high level person claimed to not be available at the time of that second group meeting and requested a 1:1 interview. From the moment this person greeted me in his office I could tell there was a 'problem.' First, he seemed quite angry to see me -- I'm not sure why, as I had never met this person before--and he was extremely hostile the entire time we met (30 minutes). He proceeded to badger me with a negative and skeptical tone about my credentials and was quite demeaning--even picking up my resume at one point and dismissively throwing it back down on his desk. At one point he flat out said 'I have no idea why I am meeting you as a finalist for this role' then asked me 'how I got to be a finalist.'

I'm not sure what this person's issue was, but I found it completely unprofessional, regardless of the industry. After all, if he had such a problem with my candidacy, he could have just provided that feedback without torturing me with a 30 minute in person meeting.  The interaction with him felt sadistic and I felt bullied.

There were people I interacted with in the process who were lovely to deal with, but overall I now find myself turned off by my first interview experience in academia and question the culture at this particular institution. I believe that if you aren't treated well in the interview process, when everyone should be trying to put their best foot forward, it might be a sign of a toxic environment.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with marketing automation systems? Do you do direct response marketing?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very standard questions and easy to answer; met with the manager and then her team.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  The people seemed nice enough.  They talked about their duties within the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; what do you see yourself doing in 5 years - basic things.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took a little while, but overall very easy, basic questions asked. I had one initial Interview with two people and then a second interview with the head of the department.
Interview Questions: What are some of your goals?

title: OSA Solution Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: 5 interviewers. Put me in a hypothetical situation of a kid trying to pay his bill but doesn’t have enough money. I tried payment plans, giving discount, credit, and saying no and they laughed/yelled at me for giving those answers and then told me they couldn’t give me more life lines. I walked out, I have never been in such a unprofessional setting. The interviewers seemed to enjoy having people struggle with a knowledge base they don’t know in. Why do they offer to train if they expect me to know the inside and out of the industry? Why did they even let me in for an interview if they wanted someone with direct experience not just phone and billing experience? So rude.... left with a horrible taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: Role play of student who wants to pay lower than tuition amount.

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on my school career website. About two weeks later, i got an invite to a day of superday interviews from current tour guides. Found out a week later that i was in!
Interview Questions: Mostly behavioral. “Describe a time you dealt with a difficult person.”

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First submit resume by email to school from pace official email lists,  then proved by one of 
 officer, after the first round. Approved person's resume will be selected. Then professor call you and have a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Talk about your working experience, especially about the data manipulating using R and Python.

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email a few days later to schedule a phone interview. Phone call was with the hiring manager and lasted about 30 minutes. I was then invited in to meet with her. The in-person interview lasted about 45 minutes. I got a call less than a week later from their central HR office offering me the position. Unfortunately the $$ was low for what I was expecting. Everyone I met with and talked to was extremely nice and professional. Would love the opportunity to work there if there was a better fit at some point in the future.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up with trends in the industry?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: video call interview, group activity, on site interview,In person interview and final interview. It was a nice experience for me. not east not tough. Interview process keeps changing according to the requirement
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
An online hackerrank test I received which was 3 hours long, and I managed to complete the test in 2 hours.

3 to 4 days after the test, I was invited for an in-person interview. It was easy and basic questions about programming and databases were asked!!
Interview Questions: Basics of programming questions

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with recruiter first then direct supervisor separately.   Fairly straightforward screening process.   Took two separate trips to city.    Some screening was also done over the phone and via email.     They followed up when they said they would.    Didn't make me wait too long.   Questions were a breeze.
Interview Questions: Why did I want this particular position.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: No interview. I was certified as a lifeguard at Pace University, at the end of the training sessions I was asked to work there. I guess in a sense my whole training was part of the interview. I only spoke with the aquatics director and not with any one from HR. There is a simple skill evaluation before you can work there. It insisted in a doing a few saves and answering a few questions about lifeguarding.
Interview Questions: Just general skill questions

title: New Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy to apply. Simple and straightforward interview. Questions were mainly about defining leadership, and strategic ways to market an audience.  Hiring process was simple and an offer was given to me a week after interviewing.
Interview Questions: Define leadership.

title: Seidenberg Development Team Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: We just met up and discussed the type of work that I would be doing for them. There really wasn't any pressure during the interview so I enjoyed being a part of it.
Interview Questions: What skills do you being to the table?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (White Plains, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional. Waited about 20 minutes in the hallway for interview to begin. Was then called in and the two women who interviewed me spent most of the time talked among themselves and then explaining the position to me. No questions were asked of me, making me believe the position had already been filled and I was wasting my time.
Interview Questions: Practically none except for preliminary questions, such as "How are you today?"

title: Enrolling Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is not the traditional one on one.  It consists of one interviewer and three potential applicants being interviewed at a time.  Majority of the interview  is essentially many questions thrown out at random to each applicant.
Interview Questions: Why are you a goof fit for PACE University ?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. I sent my resume to the assistant dean, and 3 professors contacted me within 1 month. I interviewed with 2 professors at their offices and got an offer from both.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume. Why do you want want to be a graduate assistant. Are you able to handle study and work.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
It was a through interview process and I found the staff to be meticulous about the skill sets for this position. Very professional and I had to provide a impromptu presentation demonstrating my ability. During the second interview I endured a second group interview process and the questions were what I expected concerning how you handle certain situations, management style etc.

It only became weird when I sat down with one of their executives. There was a bunch of comments but no real questions.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my background experience as it relates to the job. When I got to the second interview the executive level person asked, "What do you think this job entails?"

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviews one with about 4 academic advisors and the director. About two weeks later was another interview with two deans seperately. The first interview was great. They all seemed very nice and genuine. Each would ask a question but the director asked the most. Although there were 5 people it felt like a one on one conversation. The second interview was also great. The questions from the dean were on the spot and really kept me on my toes. Dress code- Business formal. Positive experience but never received an email or call back
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what experience do you have being on a committee, what experience do you have working with faculty, what needs do you foresee for business students, what is your ideal work environment, question about retention, criticism you ever received

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just one interview, in person. You need be good at skills that you mentioned in the resume. I was asked questions on SQL even though I wasn't pro in it. I was lot of questions on my previous work/projects and research work that I did.
Interview Questions: Some SQL related questions and my previous projects

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was briefly interviewed by the professor whom I would work alongside. I took one of her classes and a fellow colleague recommended I apply for the apprenticeship to help pay for my tuition. The job offered university credit as well as a small stipend.
Interview Questions: They asked me what my school schedule was so they could work around my hours.

title: Pace Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: You apply by emailing them with your resume and stating that you are interested in the position. If one of the professors or departments is interested in you, then he or she will email you to set up an interview. After the interview, you will know if you are hired or not within a week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Questions: Go through resume.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: I had both a phone interview, and an on site interview. Both were average interviews, but unfortunately they do not give you an answer. After my second interview I received no phone call, no e-mail, no nothing. I did not even get a response to my thank you e-mail. Both lasted no longer than 20 minutes and both were also a 2-on-1 interview. Altogether they weren't completely unorganized, but could have been run a bit smoother. There is nothing worse than getting into an interview and feeling like they did not even look at your resume, and unfortunately that is how it felt here.
Interview Questions:
"How would you ensure your success here in the first 30 days?"
"What was the biggest compliment you have ever received?"
"How can you relate past experience to this specific position?"

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Pace University in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very friendly and discussed the type of work that would be covered during the internship. Asked questions about social media and how I would contribute to their accounts. Also asked about other interests. Quick interview and good energy.
Interview Questions: How would you use Facebook to engage users during the summer?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 3 different people, amazing lady that did my interview , company is terrible though, I liked my co workers and my hiring manager.. It was an easy interview process. As other companies do they start over the phone and then u move on to in person interviews
Interview Questions: whats an aspiration in life

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was through application online. It required organization skills, file updating,answering phone,Interview was simple. assessed communication skills, eligibility and general behavioral questions etc.It took 30 minutes and was easy. Just be confident.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied with the application form online and resume through email. After two weeks, I contacted by a professor and invited me to interview. The interview only ask about the schedule and talk about what to do. Got the result right away and signed the contract after one week. Very easy interview.
Interview Questions: What's your schedule?

title: Emergency Management Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Open and comfortable interview that was more discussion based dealing with qualifications and tasks talking in general about my experience and qualifications as opposed to straight question and answer.  Was informed that the entire hiring process would be completed in 2-3 weeks. While I didn't get the position I was notified in less than 2 week which is better that being strung along for weeks to months with no response.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences dealing with hazardous materials?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions nothing too out of the ordinary. Let me speak about experiences. Make sure you do your homework and come prepared. If you do that you'll be fine. I enjoyed this interview.
Interview Questions: Strengths

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: You will be interviewing with the professor if he/she pick you resume from the department. She asked me some background questions and my skill sets. Easy and enjoyable like a chat.
Interview Questions: How good is your data analysis skill?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The usual process. You need to send your CV, recommendations, paper,,etc. If selected, they interview you at the FMA conference. Then you are invited to present your paper on site. You also need to prepare a lecture.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pace University
Interview Descriptions: Just one interview by the director, who is a nice Indian professor. The questions are very simple.
Interview Questions: If the student didn't understand your explanation, or you don't know the answer of the questions which students ask, what should you do?

title: Chemistry Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (Pleasantville, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by lab director and was given a quick chemistry test.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on 4/24/2013.  Received a call for an interview on May 8 for an onsite interview for Tuesday , May 14.  I would end up having three interviews that day with the two supervisors and the person I would ended up replacing.  The first interview was done on Pace's version of Skype.  All interviews went really well in my opinion.  Each interview was totally different based on what each person was in charge of.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Department, the Chair, Dean and Provost.  I was required to conduct a teaching demo & I attended a lunch meeting with the Department.  I submitted my application - CV, writing sample, letters of recommendation, etc, through a position advertised on Higher Ed.  The academic process is a long one - the whole process from application submission to offer is typically 9 months.  It is a year long process.  Pace is not any longer than any other institution.  The faculty, staff and administration are all very nice.  The students are great.  Other than my commute, it is great.
Interview Questions: Why Pace?

title: IT Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
It was fast and casual. questions normally are basic and more about personality that fits to the organization.
the manager called Rich was very nice. sad thing is that the salary is a bit low from what i understand. it can be great part time job for students in the campus
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registrar Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process:
Phone Interview
Face-to-Face Interview
Pass Background Check
Hired

The entire process took about a month, from start to finish. It took awhile for HR to process my application and hand it in to the hiring manager for review. The hiring manager had hundreds of applicants, so it took them awhile to get back to me. However, once they did, it did not take them too long to schedule an interview. I pretty much had two easy interviews, and the whole process went smoothly (my perception was that they were going to be very tough). The hiring manager found me to be a suitable candidate and hired me in the end.

My perceptions about the job: the job was going to be boring; the job was going to be tough; management would be rude.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted student application. Received a call about a month later to schedule an interview. Had an interview and then was called in again to be official given the job offer.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Nothing was really unexpected. Interviewer was friendly and not intimating. Very short. Great environment. Interview was easier than expected and not much was required for the position. Culture is really nice and everythkng was fully explained. All expectations were set out up front.
Interview Questions: How are your interpose all skills

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Pace University in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Knowing someone in the organization is important. Get to know the person in the hiring process and you will have a good chance of making it through. Additionally, experience in working for bureaucratic organization would help you answer questions easily.
Interview Questions: Usual questions nothing unexpected.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Pace University (White Plains, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was telephonic screening and personal interview.The professor called me and asked me about my interest,strengths and weaknesses and gave me idea that I need to commute to White plains as all my courses were at Pace NYC.
Interview Questions: What's the current project you are working on?

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Was called by one of the Senior Student Assistants called SDA's (Senior Desk Attendant) over the phone, the interview consisted of basic questions along with several scenarios on how you would encounter each situation. I answered promptly over the phone, it was an extremely easy interview. 

I e-mailed the employer, and they sent me an e-mail back saying they'd like to hire me, then the phone interview started about a week later.
Interview Questions: A drunk student is causing a ruckus outside of the Maria's Tower Community Desk, what would you do to handle this situation?

title: Master Degree Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It's very detail-oriented.
Interview Questions: What do you feel if we transfer you to another major

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pretty straightforward. Initial phone interview followed by 1:1 interview. Asked about past experience with other Professors. Overall experience was great. The position I was interviewed required significant research experience Got the offer in a month's time.
Interview Questions: Past research experience

title: Titor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The questions where easy:
- what is your favorite class?
- why do you think students need help with management science?
- Strengths and weaknesses?
- What would I do if I have a test and I need to prepare for it? Would I take a day of or will try to find time any other day?
Interview Questions: why do you think students need help with management science?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Pace University in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: They had no idea what they were hiring me for.  They first offered me the position part-time , then full time after they found out I must be full time
Interview Questions: Can you also teach a class in Chemistry?  I had never taken Chemistry

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Pace University (New York, NY) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: HR and department communication was confusing.  Entire process took 3-4 weeks.  HR and department were very slow in setting up interview session.  First there was a phone interview.  Then a group interview.
Interview Questions: i was asked how many children I have.

title: Clinical Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pace University (Pleasantville, NY) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview and review of practice experience , review of educational qualifications
Interview Questions: typical interview. I found the process professional
